points: Numerical Aptitude is the ability to understand numerical relationships and handle numerical concepts. It measures how well a person can reason with and use numbers, and work with quantitative materials and ideas.
Numerical Aptitude is relevant for any sort of work in which accurate calculations or precise measurements are needed to be made.

1: It may be very difficult for you to understand numerical concepts and perform computations using numbers.
You might require a lot of time to grasp new numerical concepts and their manipulation.
It might not be possible for you to recognize numerical relationships or apply numerical reasoning for decision making.
2: You have a reasonable level of understanding of numerical concepts and an average capacity to perform computations using numbers.
You may be able to learn new numerical concepts and manipulate them fairly effectively.
You are likely to be fairly good at identifying the relevant numerical information required for decision making and applying numerical reasoning while analyzing information.
3: You have a superior understanding of numerical concepts and mathematical operations
You are likely to excel at tasks that require the ability to perform complex computations using numbers.
It's easy for you to learn new numerical concepts quickly and effectively manipulate them.
You are very good at identifying the relevant numerical information needed to enhance decision making.
You are consistent in applying sound numerical reasoning when analyzing information and recognizing the numerical relationships among apparently different concepts.

intro.1: You can improve your Numerical Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Numerical Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a highly developed Numerical Aptitude.

1: Practice performing calculations without a calculator.
Work on improving understanding of basic mathematical operations as well as concepts of simple statistics and data representation as graphs and charts etc.
Sudoku and many other number games, puzzles etc. are really good to build up short-cuts and reasoning abilities where numbers are concerned.

Develop a deep understanding of numbers and how they behave by rigorously practicing a lot of numerical problems. Start with easy to solve problems. This will build your confidence to work your way to tougher ones.
2: Develop a deep understanding of numbers and how they behave by rigorously practicing a lot of numerical problems ranging from basic ones to more advanced and complex ones.
Work on improving understanding of basic mathematical operations as well as concepts of simple statistics and data representation in the form of graphs and charts etc.
Sudoku and many other number games, puzzles etc. are really good to build up short-cuts and reasoning abilities where numbers are concerned.

points: Verbal Aptitude is the ability to understand and apply concepts framed in words. It demonstrates your ability to reason with words, deduce meaningful relationships from them and to manipulate ideas on an abstract level.
Verbal Aptitude is important for any work that requires the understanding of complex verbal relationships and skill in manipulating verbal concepts.

1: Your command over language is not up to the mark. While you will be able to formulate arguments in a fairly logical manner, you may face difficulty understanding the finer points of complex arguments.
You may find it difficult to understand new ideas, and explain them coherently to others.
Tasks that require the understanding of complex verbal relationships and skill in manipulating verbal concepts can turn out to be tough for you.
2: Your communication skills are good. You can understand others’ views and articulate your own points to an extent.
You have a reasonable ability to find the right words to explain ideas and to interpret written and spoken instructions.
You are fairly good at grasping new verbal concepts and learning new languages.
3: You are excellent at communication. You can comprehend others’ views very well and articulate your own points, easily framing supporting arguments.
You have a very high ability to find the right words to explain ideas and to interpret written and spoken instructions.
You are likely to be very quick at grasping new verbal concepts and learning new languages.
You are highly effective at integrating relevant information from diverse perspectives, recognizing subtle relationships among apparently different concepts or ideas.

intro.1: You can improve your Verbal Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Verbal Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a well-developed verbal aptitude.

1: Build word power: develop a good vocabulary through extensive reading.
Use a dictionary to help you and look up new words for their meanings and synonyms.
Improving Verbal Reasoning Skills by playing word games or games like spotting the odd word out, finding synonyms or spelling challenges.
2: Build a good vocabulary through extensive reading.
Improve Verbal Reasoning Skills by playing word games or games like spotting the odd word out, finding synonyms or spelling challenges.
Try to write out stories – especially creative ones where you have to work out the flow, the reasoning etc.
Actively take up part discussions and debates which will enable you to express yourself through words.

points: Mechanical Reasoning is the ability to understand basic mechanical principles of machinery, tools, and motion. The focus is on simple principles that involve reasoning as opposed to specific knowledge.
Mechanical Reasoning   is important for any sort of work involving the application of principles of commonly encountered physical forces, and design, operation or repair of equipment.

1: It may be difficult for you to understand the principles of physical forces and mechanical elements or apply them in practical situations.
You may not be able to learn unfamiliar mechanical concepts quickly and may find it very difficult to install devices or equipment.
The ability to diagnose problems involving machinery and make repairs may not come naturally to you.
2: You are fairly good at tasks that require an understanding of the principles of physical forces and mechanical elements.
You may possess a reasonable level of mechanical expertise which can be applied in practical situations.
You are likely to be able to grasp new or unfamiliar mechanical concepts moderately well and can install common devices or equipment.
The ability to diagnose problems involving machinery or equipment and make lasting repairs, is fairly good.
3: You are excellent at tasks that require an understanding of the principles of physical forces and mechanical elements and can apply these in practical situations.
You possess a broad level of mechanical expertise that can be applied across several roles or functions.
You are likely to be very good at learning new or unfamiliar mechanical concepts quickly and installing complex devices or equipment in a manner that meets or exceeds specifications.
You are quick and accurate in diagnosing complex problems involving machinery or equipment and making repairs that would rarely or never require rework.

intro.1: You can improve your Mechanical Reasoning through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Mechanical Reasoning through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a high mechanical reasoning ability

1: You may undertake ‘do-it-yourself’ projects, or repair things around your home, for giving yourself the scope to exercise your mechanical competence.
You can work with construction kits or simply take discarded household devices apart and put them back together again.
Improve your understanding of simple concepts related to forces and machines and their applications in practical situations.
2: You may undertake ‘do-it-yourself’ projects, or repair things around your home, for giving yourself the scope to exercise your mechanical competence.
Practice problems involving concepts on: Mechanics, Structures, Energy and Forces
You can work with construction kits or simply take discarded household devices apart and put them back together again.
Participate in industrial visits and observe working of different types of machinery.

points: Abstract reasoning refers to the ability to reason beyond the obvious. It is concerned with being able to understand complex concepts and assimilate new information beyond previous experience. It includes the ability to detect and analyze patterns and relationships among discrete pieces of information and solve problems on a complex, intangible level.
Abstract Reasoning is necessary for success in positions that require effective problem solving and decision-making, especially when nonverbal forms of information are involved.

1: You may find it difficult to draw accurate conclusions from the available information and solve problems on a complex, thought-based level.
Working with new concepts, recognizing patterns and similarities among things may not come naturally to you.
You are not likely to be oriented towards combining pieces of relevant information from diverse perspectives and integrating verbal and non-verbal ideas.
2: To an extent you are capable of analyzing information and solving problems, although not on a complex, thought-based level.
You may be fairly good at working with new concepts and ideas and recognizing relationships among things.
You are likely to be reasonably good at integrating pieces of relevant information from diverse perspectives and dealing with non-verbal problems.
3: You hold great ability to analyze information and solve problems on a complex, thought-based level.
You are proficient at working with new concepts, abstract ideas and recognizing patterns and similarities between them.
You are likely to be very good at identifying non-obvious causes of problems and drawing accurate conclusions from the available information.
You demonstrate high ability in developing insight into non-verbal problems and integrating pieces of relevant information from diverse perspectives.

intro.1: You can improve your Abstract Reasoning through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Abstract Reasoning through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a high level of abstract reasoning ability.

1: Be a fine observer – observe receptively what happens around you with an open mind and attempt to observe the patterns in human and nature’s behavior.
You can exercise your abstract reasoning skills by practicing solving puzzles, optical illusions, and other “brain teasers”.
Engage with problems that you enjoy solving and look for ways of approaching them from a different angle more abstractly. Try forming theories about ways of solving these problems.
Seek out and practice abstract problems and thought experiments in newspapers, magazines and quiz books, and from online platforms.
2: You can exercise your abstract reasoning skills by practicing solving puzzles, optical illusions, and other “brain teasers”.
Engage with problems that you enjoy solving and look for ways of approaching them from a different angle more abstractly. Try forming theories about ways of solving these problems.
Seek out and practice abstract problems and thought experiments in newspapers, magazines and quiz books, and from online platforms.
Use improvisations: such skills may also help increase your creativity and abstract thinking skills.

points: Spatial Aptitude is concerned with the understanding of space and dimensions, and visualizing of objects in 2-D and 3-D perspectives. It is the skill to analyze, comprehend and express imaginary signs and shapes.
Spatial Aptitude is important in positions that require the ability to mentally create and manipulate images derived from written plans

1: You might not do well in work where it is important to understand three-dimensional relationships between objects.
You may find it difficult to visualize a three dimensional object from a pattern or to visualize an object if rotated in space.
Your ability to manipulate shapes and relate three-dimensional objects to their pictures may not be good.
2: You have an average level of ability to visualize a three dimensional object from a pattern and also to visualize an object if rotated in space.
You would do fairly well in work where it is important to understand three-dimensional relationships between objects.
To an extent you will be able to manipulate shapes in two dimensions and visualize three-dimensional objects presented as two-dimensional pictures.
3: You would excel in work where it is required to manipulate shapes in two dimensions or to visualize three-dimensional objects presented as two-dimensional pictures.
You have a high ability to accurately visualize a three dimensional object from a pattern or blueprint and also to visualize an object if rotated in space.
You would do very well in work where it is important to understand three-dimensional relationships between objects.

intro.1: You can improve your Spatial Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Spatial Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a high spatial aptitude

1: Try to get involved in activities such as drawing, carpentry, and photography and play computer games which require navigation.
Practice assembling and making things: you could build models or assemble jigsaw puzzles. Three-dimensional puzzles provide very good practice in imagining how complex parts fit together.
Try solving Rubik's cube (considered the perfect brain training), or learning strategy games that involve moving pieces, like checkers and chess.
2: Take up activities like 2D drawing or drawing which includes outlines, edges and shading.
Practice assembling and making things: you could build models or assemble jigsaw puzzles. Three-dimensional puzzles provide very good practice in imagining how complex parts fit together.
Try Solving Rubik’s cube (considered the perfect brain training), or learning strategy games that involve moving pieces, like checkers and chess.

points: Perceptual aptitude is the ability to respond promptly to different kinds of stimuli, particularly visual, gained through sensory systems and to process the information quickly for manipulating and interpreting the environment.
Perceptual aptitude is important in many kinds of routine or detailed work and also for work where precision is required.

1: You may have difficulty in working with speed and accuracy.
Making logical decisions based upon visual information may not be easy for you
Work where attention to detail and quality are important may not be suitable for you.
2: You are capable of working with a fair amount of accuracy and speed.
You are reasonably good at making logical decisions based upon visual information.
You are likely to perform moderately well in work where attention to detail and quality are important.
3: You are capable of working with high levels of speed and accuracy.
You are excellent at making logical decisions based upon visual information and also possess a high ability to compare and mark written lists quickly and accurately.
You are likely to excel in work where attention to detail and quality are important.

intro.1: You can improve your Perceptual Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Perceptual Aptitude through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a highly developed perceptual aptitude

1: Take part in activities that involve identifying and recognizing letters (e.g., matching letters or whole words or finding and outlining forms, pictures or letters that are hidden in a large picture)
Try solving puzzles like jigsaws of designs, letters, pictures, words, etc. and ‘spot the difference’ games or memory games that are available online and in print.
Virtual games that require quick reflexes can improve your perceptual skills provided that you spend only a limited amount of time with greater focus.
Pay attention to detail in observing things around you and try to filter out relevant information.
2: Take part in activities that involve identifying and recognizing letters (e.g., matching letters or whole words or finding and outlining forms, pictures or letters that are hidden in a large picture)
Try solving puzzles like jigsaws with designs, letters, pictures, words, etc. and ‘spot the difference’ games or memory games that are available online and in print.
Virtual games that require quick reflexes can improve your perceptual skills provided that you spend only a limited amount of time with greater focus.
Play sports which require fast reaction time such as badminton, table tennis and squash, etc.

points: It refers to keeping emotions in check and not being susceptible to temptation; being calm or easygoing and pleasant even in very difficult situations.

1: You may feel enraged when things do not go your way. You are likely to be sensitive about being treated unfairly and feel resentful and bitter when you feel you are being cheated.

You feel strong cravings and urges that you have difficulty resisting.  At times you may get frustrated quickly you tend to be oriented toward short-term pleasures and rewards rather than long-term consequences.
2: You are usually an easy-going person but might get angry at times. Your level of anger is moderate.
To an extent you will be able to resist temptations but you might fall in as it gets stronger. You do experience strong cravings and consequently find yourselves tempted to overindulge.
3: It’s not easy to provoke you or make you angry as you show high levels of emotional stability. You may be able to execute difficult tasks without losing your temper.
You find it easier to resist and overcome temptations and also can tolerate strong, irresistible cravings.

intro.1: You can improve your Self Control through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Self Control through the following strategies:
intro.3: Your self control is high.

1: Observe what happens during moments of losing self control and critically examine the causes of your behavior
Set specific goals for improvement: Understand precisely what you are trying to control.
Decrease exposure to things that lead to undesirable behavior.
Increase the attractiveness of the desirable behavior: acknowledge even the slightest of benefits that you get when you move towards the right behavior.
Create a recovery plan: Understand that you’ll probably experience setbacks and your self-control might fail. Don’t be harsh on yourself over a failure – try again.
2: Observe what happens during moments of losing self control and critically examine the causes of your behavior
Set goals for improvement: Understand precisely what you are trying to control.
Decrease exposure to things that lead to undesirable behavior.
Increase the attractiveness of the desirable behavior: acknowledge even the slightest of benefits that you get when you move towards the right behavior.

points: It is the ability to be confident, fearless, and remain calm and composed while dealing with stressful situations

1: You may often feel like something dangerous is about to happen. You may be afraid of specific situations or be just generally fearful. You may feel tense, jittery, and nervous.
You may experience feelings of sadness, hopelessness and loneliness. You may be  easily discouraged and often demotivated
You are very likely to be concerned about rejection and ridicule that cause you to feel shy and uncomfortable around others. You may feel easily embarrassed.

You may experience panic, confusion, and helplessness when under pressure or stress. You might find it extremely difficult to cope with stress, becoming dependent, hopeless, or panicked when facing emergency situations.
2: You are mostly calm and relaxed. But occasionally you feel anxious or afraid of specific situations.
You tend to be free from depressive feelings. However sometimes, you may experience emotions like guilt, sadness, hopelessness, and loneliness.
Generally, you do not feel nervous in social situations, but at times your concern about rejection and ridicule cause you to feel shy and uncomfortable around others.

You perceive yourselves as capable of handling yourselves in difficult situations. But you might feel unable to cope with stress, becoming dependent, hopeless, or panicked when facing emergency situations.
3: You are generally calm, relaxed and fearless. You do not usually worry about things that might go wrong.
You tend to be free from depressive feelings and rarely feel guilty, sad, hopeless and lonely.
You are not bothered about how others may perceive and judge you and do not feel nervous in social situations.
You tend to remain poised, confident, and clear-headed when stressed. You are able to handle yourself in difficult situations.

intro.1: You can improve your Stress Tolerance through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Stress Tolerance through the following strategies:
intro.3: Your stress tolerance is high.

1: Recognize your stress and name it: Ignoring your stress doesn’t improve your tolerance to it. But paying attention to it and putting it into words does.

Change your position or your perspective: You may not be able to change or control external circumstances causing your stress, but you can take other actions, like changing your position, your role, or your perspective.
Don’t be afraid of the stress: Getting afraid about your stress increases the stress. But if you think that stress is a natural or even helpful response, then you can manage it in a better way.
Check in with your values: One of the causes for internal stress is going against your values or what you want. It’s worth figuring out what you really value if you want to better manage your stress.
Allow yourself recovery time: When a stressful situation comes your way, especially one involving a big loss or change, be sure to allow yourself time to recover.
Get support: Experts agree that one of the key factors in how well we handle stress is whether we have support when we are stressed. Seek the help of a qualified professional if required
2: Recognize your stress and name it: Ignoring your stress doesn’t improve your tolerance to it. But paying attention to it and putting it into words does.

Change your position or your perspective: You may not be able to change or control external circumstances causing your stress, but you can take other actions, like changing your position, your role, or your perspective.
Don’t be afraid of the stress: Getting afraid about your stress increases the stress. But if you think that stress is a natural or even helpful response, then you can manage it in a better way.
Allow yourself recovery time: When a stressful situation comes your way, especially one involving a big loss or change, be sure to allow yourself time to recover.
Get support: Experts agree that one of the key factors in how well we handle stress is whether we have support when we are stressed. Talk it over with someone who can help you.

points: Being compassionate is having concern for others and being helpful, generous and considerate towards them. It is believing that others are honest and well meaning.

1: You often feel that others are selfish, dishonest, and potentially dangerous.
You are not particularly interested in social services. Requests for help feel like a responsibility rather than an opportunity for self-fulfillment.
You do not get strongly affected by human suffering. You pride yourself on making objective judgments based on reason and you prefer facts over feelings and emotions.
2: You are disposed to believe that others are honest and well-intentioned, but you are aware about possible tricky intentions of others.
You have a reasonable concern for others' welfare and a willingness to assist others in need, but usually you may do this at your own expense.
You are usually moved by others' needs, but at times you tend to be more practical and less moved by sympathetic appeals to pity. Sometimes you value making rational decisions based on logic.
3: You assume that most people are fair, honest, and have good intentions.
You find helping other people genuinely rewarding. You tend to assist the needy even at your own cost as you find doing things for others is a form of self-fulfillment rather than self-sacrifice.
You are tenderhearted and compassionate. Feel the pain of others vicariously and are easily moved to pity.

intro.1: You can improve your Compassion through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Compassion through the following strategies:
intro.3: Your compassion is high.

1: Listen attentively: Listen with the intent of understanding. This will give others a sense of being heard.
Remember the whole person: When someone exhibits an undesirable behavior, do not equate it to them as a whole. Remind yourself of their positive qualities

Put yourself in the other person’s position: Suffering is universal although the particular details of the problems may be subjective. Remind yourself of a time when you went through something related.

Practice expressing gratitude. It is important to appreciate the positive events and people in your life. This will help you practice humility and reciprocate the goodness you have received from others.
2: Try to listen attentively to others with the intention of understanding and give people your undivided attention.
Suspend judgment and be open minded while interacting with others.
Remember the whole person: When someone exhibits an undesirable behavior, do not equate it to them as a whole. Remind yourself of their positive qualities

Put yourself in the other person’s position: Suffering is universal although the particular details of the problems may be subjective. Remind yourself of a time when you went through something related.

Practice expressing gratitude. It is important to appreciate the positive events and people in your life. This will help you practice humility and reciprocate the goodness you have received from others.

points: Politeness refers to being cooperative, forgiving, humble, mild-mannered; being sincere and unwilling to manipulate through flattery or deception.

1: You tend to show yourselves as superior to others and may be seen as disagreeably arrogant by other people.
You are not likely to consider it important to use words of courtesy and expression of gratitude. At times you may not even mind intimidating others to get things going your way.
You believe that a certain amount of deception in social relationships is required.
2: You generally give way to others and tend to forgive and forget. But at times, you prefer to compete rather than to cooperate and have no reluctance to express aggression.
You are usually humble and gracious. However occasionally you tend to believe that you are superior and may be considered conceited or arrogant by others.
You are generally frank, sincere, and trusting. But sometimes you consider flattery, cunningness, or deception as necessary survival tactics and may regard more straightforward people as naive.
3: You dislike confrontations. You are perfectly willing to compromise or to deny your own needs in order to get along with others.
You do not like to claim that you are better than other people, though you are not necessarily lacking in self-confidence or self-esteem.
You see no need for pretense or manipulation when dealing with others and are therefore candid, frank, and sincere in your interactions.

intro.1: You can improve your Politeness through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Politeness through the following strategies:
intro.3: You are highly polite.

1: Incorporate greeting culture: Use your energy to express formal greetings and don’t be hesitant to apologize when it’s required.
Compliment others: Take initiative in praising others. Be enthusiastic and true to your words.
Don’t say anything negative: You should try to find new ways to express disapproval that are more polite than going with your regular responses that may sound very negative.
Respect your stance: You may have to disagree with others, but you can do so without causing conflict by keeping a positive tone of voice and smiling face.

Body language: Don’t forget, when it’s appropriate, to embrace and use your body language to accentuate your words and praises. They make you a more characteristic and memorable person, and people will easily remember your rhetoric and positive attitude.
2: Compliment others: Take initiative in praising others. Be enthusiastic and true to your words.
Respect your stance: You may have to disagree with others, but you can do so without causing conflict by keeping a positive tone of voice and smiling face.

Body language: Don’t forget, when it’s appropriate, to embrace, shake hands, and use your body language to accentuate your words and praises. They make you a more characteristic and memorable person, and people will easily remember your rhetoric and positive attitude.

points: Industriousness constitutes the ability to constantly engage in goal directed behavior, having high aspirations and being self-motivated.

1: You may feel ineffective, and may have a sense that you are not in control of your  own life.
You are content to get by with a minimal amount of work, and might be seen by others as lazy.
You may procrastinate and show poor follow-through, often failing to complete tasks-even tasks you want very much to complete.
Often it is difficult to set goals and accomplish them.
2: Although you are generally well-prepared to deal with life you may sometimes have a poor opinion of your abilities and feel that you are underprepared and inept.
You may have high aspiration levels and goal directed behavior. However, sometimes you may seem aimless and lazy.
Sometimes you find it hard to complete the tasks you have begun due to boredom or other distractions. Usually, you can motivate yourselves to get the job done.
3: You set very high standards for yourself and you are self-motivated.
You strive hard to achieve excellence. Your drive to be recognized as successful keeps you on track toward your challenging goals.
You are able to overcome reluctance to begin tasks and stay on track despite distractions.

intro.1: You can improve your Industriousness through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Industriousness through the following strategies:
intro.3: You are highly industrious

1: Set yourself goals and persevere in achieving them despite challenges you may have to face. You may start off with small, well defined goals and later extend to larger ones.

Get busy. Many individuals spend a considerable amount of time sitting around, thinking, wondering and worrying. However, if you simply start on and get engaged in some useful activity, you will find that there aren’t as many complex problems, as you had expected, hindering your progress.

Surround yourself with individuals who are engaged in productive activity. People tend to enjoy those activities that appear like group activities, and this can help you develop your own industriousness.
Find activities that you enjoy and participate in them. People enjoy the fruits of their labor even more when the activity itself is enjoyable.
2: Don’t settle for mediocrity. Identify and take up tasks that could better utilize your potential and improve your strengths/skill sets.

Surround yourself with individuals who are engaged in productive activity. People tend to enjoy those activities that appear like group activities, and this can help you develop your own industriousness.
Find activities that you enjoy and participate in them. People enjoy the fruits of their labor even more when the activity itself is enjoyable.
Look around for what work needs to be done for self or for others. Participating in resolving these things can help one to feel useful and helpful.

points: Orderliness refers to being neat, tidy, well-organized and methodical; having a strong sense of duty and obligations; having the ability to think carefully before acting; being cautious and deliberate.

1: You are likely to be disorganized and scattered as you may find it difficult to stick to schedules and follow routines.
You may find contracts, rules, and regulations overly confining. Others might see you as unreliable or irresponsible.
You are often impulsive, and say or do things that come to your mind without deliberating alternative options and the probable consequences of those alternatives.
2: You are usually neat, tidy, and well-organized. But there are times when you tend to get disorganized.

You try to adhere strictly to your ethical principles and scrupulously fulfill your moral obligations as you understand them. However sometimes, you are more flexible about such matters and may appear to be somewhat undependable or unreliable.
You generally take decisions after careful consideration, but at times you end up being hasty and speak or act without considering the consequences.
3: You are well-organized and like to keep lists and make plans. You enjoy living according to routines and schedules and may get disturbed if things get out of hand.
You have a strong sense of moral obligation.
You are cautious and deliberate. And take your time when making decisions.

intro.1: You can practice Orderliness through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can practice Orderliness through the following strategies:
intro.3: You are highly orderly.

1: Arrange the space around you in the way you like, keep it orderly and attractive. Have a place for your things and put them away when you finish using them. Order around you creates order inside you.
Make step by step plans and follow them. Break down complex problems into small parts and handle them one at a time. Make use of Flow charts and To Do lists

Stick to your daily work plan by regulating your sleep pattern and food habits. Being punctual will give you more time on hand. Repeated practice will make being orderly a part of your natural behavior.
2: Make step by step plans and follow them: Break down problems into small parts and handle them one at a time. Make use of flow charts and to do lists.

Stick to your daily work plan by maintaining your sleep pattern and food habits. Being punctual will give you more time in hand. Repeated practice will make being orderly a part of your natural behavior.

points: Enthusiasm refers to the ability to experience spontaneous joy and a high degree of preference to socialize.

1: You may be reserved and do not reach out to others and thus it is likely that you appear to be cold and distant.
You tend to feel overwhelmed by large crowds and therefore actively avoid social gatherings.
You are less spontaneous in experiencing high spirits such as happiness, enthusiasm, optimism, and joy.
2: Although you are usually affectionate and friendly, and genuinely like people it may be difficult for you at times to form close attachments to others.
Generally, you enjoy the company of others. But at times your need for privacy and time to reflect matters more for you.
You tend to remain cheerful and optimistic and are able to laugh easily most of the time.
3: You genuinely like people and openly appreciate them. You can make friends quickly and it is easy for you to form close, intimate relationships.
You find the company of others pleasantly stimulating and rewarding. You enjoy the excitement of crowds. You love bright lights and hustle and bustle.
You enjoy being the center of attention, being a sensation seeker.
It is very natural for you to experience positive emotions like happiness, enthusiasm, optimism, and joy.

intro.1: You can improve your Enthusiasm through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Enthusiasm through the following strategies:
intro.3: You are highly enthusiastic

1: Find what interests you: Develop a love for learning. Ask a lot of questions and do plenty of exploration.

Focus on the good: Look for the opportunities that difficulties offer and live your life with gratitude. Focus on what you can do instead of what you can’t. If you focus too much on the negative, it can zap you of your creativity, energy, and productivity.

Hang around with enthusiastic people: Enthusiasm is contagious. The more you can find ways to connect with and develop relationships with enthusiastic people, the more excitement will “rub off” on you, inspiring you to want to do more.
2: Find what interests you: Develop a love for learning. Ask a lot of questions and do plenty of exploration.

Hang around with enthusiastic people: Enthusiasm is contagious. The more you can find ways to connect with and develop relationships with enthusiastic people, the more excitement will “rub off” on you, inspiring you to want to do more.

points: It refers to being dominant, forceful, and socially able; having the ability to take charge and assume leadership.

1: You generally let others control the activities of groups that you are part of and limit your participation.
You like to follow a slow, leisurely and relaxed pace in life.
You are overwhelmed by noise and commotion and tend to avoid thrill-seeking.
2: Usually, you speak without hesitation and like to lead a group, but at times you prefer to keep in the background and let others do the talking.
You are not necessarily sluggish or lazy and generally like to lead a fast-paced life, but sometimes you prefer to be more leisurely and relaxed in tempo.
You seek excitement and stimulation most of the time. You may prefer bright colors and loud environments. But at times, you avoid thrill seeking as it no longer excites you very much.
3: You like to speak out, take charge, and be the leader in groups that you are part of.
You are likely to lead a fast-paced, busy life. You move about quickly, energetically, and vigorously, and you like to get involved in multiple activities.
You might get bored when things are not interesting. Taking risks and seeking thrills might excite you a lot.

intro.1: You can improve your Assertiveness through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Assertiveness through the following strategies:
intro.3: You are highly assertive.

1: Make the decision to positively assert yourself: Commit to being assertive rather than being passive or aggressive and start practicing this today.

Aim for open communication: Be honest and tell others how you feel or what you want without making accusations or making them feel guilty. Remember to respect other people when you are sharing your feelings, wants, needs, beliefs or opinions.
Listen actively: Try to understand the other person’s point of view and don’t interrupt when they are explaining it to you.
Agree to disagree: Remember that having a different point of view doesn’t mean you are right and the other person is wrong.
Practice assertiveness: Talk in an assertive way in front of a mirror or with a friend. Pay attention to your body language as well as to the words you say.
Use assertive phrases without being aggressive: Stick with statements that include ‘I’ in them such as ‘I think’ or ‘I feel’. Don’t use aggressive language such as ‘you always’ or ‘you never’.
2: Make the decision to positively assert yourself: Commit to being assertive rather than being passive or aggressive and start practicing this.
Aim for open and honest communication: Remember to respect other people when you are sharing your feelings, wants, needs, beliefs or opinions.
Agree to disagree: Remember that having a different point of view doesn’t mean you are right and the other person is wrong.
Practice assertiveness: Talk in an assertive way in front of a mirror or with a friend. Pay attention to your body language as well as to the words you say.
Use assertive phrases without being aggressive: Stick with statements that include ‘I’ in them such as ‘I think’ or ‘I feel’. Don’t use aggressive language such as ‘you always’ or ‘you never’.

points: Intellect refers to intellectual curiosity; willingness to consider novel ideas; originality and quickness.

1: You may be slow in doing complex tasks and you may find it difficult to face unexpected problems.
You are likely to be better at dealing with people or things rather than with ideas.
You may regard intellectual exercises as difficult to understand or as a waste of time.
2: Usually, you enjoy both philosophical arguments and brain teasers but you may prefer not to engage in such tasks very often.
You don’t get curious about things generally and, you tend to narrowly focus your intellectual resources on limited topics.
3: You are open-minded to new and unusual ideas and focus on tackling new challenges.
You like to debate intellectual issues as you are happy to think about abstract ideas.
You enjoy riddles, puzzles, and brain teasers.

intro.1: You can improve your Intellect through the following strategies:
intro.2: You can improve your Intellect through the following strategies:
intro.3: You have a high intellect.

1: Invest in self-directed, life-long learning; continually acquire new knowledge, skills and competencies to adapt to new challenges.
Stay alert. Be curious about the world around you, and don't be afraid to ask questions, even those that others might consider as irrelevant.

Engage in new thoughts and ideas: A thirst for knowledge and an interest in new information may come more naturally to some than to others. However, a conscious effort to read up on new ideas, pay attention to sensory experiences, learn a new language, and pick up new skills can stimulate your intellect
Don’t be afraid to get out of your comfort zone: Be prepared to try things which are new to you.
Collaborate and network with people; build and enhance your relationships, especially with those who are wiser and/or who demand more out of you.
Read extensively, also covering areas which are outside of your interest domains
2: Invest in self-directed, life-long learning; continually acquire new knowledge, skills and competencies to adapt to new challenges.
Stay alert. Be curious about the world around you, and don't be afraid to ask questions, even those that others might consider as irrelevant.
Collaborate and network with people; build and enhance your relationships, especially with those who are wiser and/or who demand more out of you.
Read extensively, also covering areas which are outside your interest domains.

points: Openness refers to the individual's willingness to try out new things,  ability to think outside the box and act  differently.

1: You are likely to be more oriented to facts than fantasy.
It might be difficult for you to find an interest and sense of beauty  in most forms of art
It may be difficult for you to identify and express emotions accurately
You are very likely to prefer routine over variety and ‘change’ is something you might find uncomfortable.
You prefer the security and stability brought by conformity to tradition
2: You are usually appreciative of art and  find beauty in nature
You are likely to welcome unconventional values  and respect diverse viewpoints
You tend to be involved in imagination and fantasy to an extent, but at times, you are more straightforward and prefer to keep your mind on the task at hand.

You may experience deeper and more differentiated emotional states and feel both happiness and unhappiness more keenly than others do. Occasionally, you do not believe that feeling states are of much importance.
You prefer novelty and variety to familiarity and routine. Over time, you may engage in a series of different hobbies. However, you find ‘change’ difficult at times.
You tend to accept authority and to honor tradition
3: You tend  to be highly appreciative of arts and  find beauty in nature
Being psychologically and politically liberal; being anti-tradition and anti-authority.
You are likely to use fantasy as a way of creating a richer, more interesting world.
You are likely to have good access and awareness of your own feelings and the feelings of others.
You might have  a readiness to challenge authority, conventional wisdom, and traditional values.

intro.1: You can develop and maintain certain openness habits that can maximize your potential for creative growth:
intro.2: You can develop and maintain certain openness habits that can maximize your potential for creative growth:
intro.3: Your openness is high.

1: Expose yourself to nature and art: One of the characteristics of those who score high on the openness measure is the involvement in aesthetically triggering experiences and the appreciation of artistic events. Going to art galleries and plays or even going for a walk in nature may stimulate your perceptions and increase your aesthetic sensitivity.

Bring changes in your routine: Following too rigid a schedule can limit your sense of receptiveness to new experiences. In order to benefit from the creativity that is correlated with this personality trait, you may want to incorporate an adventurous spirit in your day-to-day life. Adding variety in daily choices may help bring out the openness side of your personality.

Find a way to change things: If your current work/activity doesn’t interest you, or if you find yourself dreading work, that’s a sign you need to change. Either look at how you can change your work or remember why you got started in the first place, and change your feelings about your work.
2: Expose yourself to nature and art: One of the characteristics of those who score high on the openness measure is the involvement in aesthetically triggering experiences and the appreciation of artistic events. Going to art galleries and plays or even going for a walk in nature may stimulate your perceptions and increase your aesthetic sensitivity.

Bring changes in your routine: Following too rigid a schedule can limit your sense of receptiveness to new experiences. In order to benefit from the creativity that is correlated with this personality trait, you may want to incorporate an adventurous spirit in your day-to-day life. Adding variety in daily choices may help bring out the openness side of your personality.

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference are results oriented and allow employees to use their strongest abilities, giving them a feeling of accomplishment. Corresponding needs are Ability Utilization and Achievement.
list: Ability Utilization — Workers on this job make use of their individual abilities.
Achievement — Workers on this job get a feeling of accomplishment.

intro.1: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are Very Important.
intro.2: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are of Average Importance.
intro.3: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are Very Important..

1: Having good work conditions
Being well paid and having good benefits
Having a job with low risk of a change in pay or work duties
Having a variety of things to do on the job
2: Chance to use your strongest skills and feel good about your work
Being challenged and doing interesting work
Learning and gaining new skills
3: Chance to use your strongest skills and feel good about your work
Being challenged and doing interesting work
Learning and gaining new skills

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference allow employees to work on their own and make decisions. Corresponding needs are Creativity, Responsibility and Autonomy.
list: Creativity — Workers on this job try out their own ideas.
Responsibility — Workers on this job make decisions on their own.
Autonomy — Workers on this job plan their work with little supervision

2: Able to decide what work you do
Supervising your own work
Being creative and finding new ways to do things
3: Able to decide what work you do

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference offer advancement, potential for leadership, and are often considered prestigious. Corresponding needs are Advancement, Authority, Recognition and Social Status.
list: Advancement — Workers on this job have opportunities for advancement.
Recognition — Workers on this job receive recognition for the work they do.
Authority — Workers on this job give directions and instructions to others.
Social Status — Workers on this job are looked up to by others in their company and their community.

intro.1: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are of Little Importance.
intro.2: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are of Average Importance.
intro.3: For you; on your ideal job, the below given work values are Very Important..

1: Chance to move up and be a leader
Being able to direct and influence others
Having an important or prestigious job
2: Chance to move up and be a leader
Being able to direct and influence others
Having an important or prestigious job
3: Chance to move up and be a leader

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference allow employees to provide service to others and work with co-workers in a friendly non-competitive environment. Corresponding needs are Co-workers, Moral Values and Social Service.
list: Co-workers — Workers on this job have co-workers who are easy to get along with.
Social Service — Workers on this job have work where they do things for other people.
Moral Values — Workers on this job are never pressured to do things that go against their sense of right and wrong.

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference offer supportive management that stands behind employees. Corresponding needs are Company Policies, Supervision: Human Relations and Supervision: Technical.
list: Company Policies and Practices — Workers on this job are treated fairly by the company.
Supervision, Human Relations — Workers on this job have supervisors who back up their workers with management.
Supervision, Technical — Workers on this job have supervisors who train their workers well.

points: Jobs/Careers that satisfy this work value preference offer job security and good working conditions. Corresponding needs are Activity, Compensation, Independence, Security, Variety and Working Conditions.
list: Activity — Workers on this job are busy all the time.
Independence — Workers on this job do their work alone.
Variety — Workers on this job have something different to do every day.
Compensation — Workers on this job are paid well in comparison with other workers.
Security — Workers on this job have steady employment.
Working Conditions — Workers on this job have good working conditions.
